content.description: Start matched bottom left on a good crimp. Move up the mini-arete and diagonal right. Once the crimps run out towards the right, top out straight up on jugs. Crux is the middle traverse right after the mini arete and before the jugs to finish.
content.protection: Spotter is best bet, pads wouldn't help much on the uneven rocky slope. Definitely bring if you have them.
content.location: After leaving the hog rock trail and looking down slope, the route is on the left side of glacier boulder. If you're looking up at the boulder from downslope, its obviously on the right side--amongst the mini boulders and debris.

content.description: Beautiful carved out boulder located just off the hog rock nature trail. Potential for some very hard routes, has plenty of space for FA's. Good mix of crimpy holds and overhung jugs.
